snippet: The nature of influence and political clout in New York, and many of the groups and people who hold it, is changing.
abstract: Nature of influence and political power in New York, and many of the groups and people who hold it, is changing; the New York Times reporters who cover the region identify the powerful figures on their beats and explain what gives them clout and where they fall on the chain of influence. Photos (M)0
lead_paragraph: THE countdown clock on Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg's wall is running, so he can tell you exactly how many days are left in this, his third and final term: 604 on Monday. Whoever holds the mayor's office next will chart New York's direction. But succeeding Mr. Bloomberg is not the same as replacing him. His enormous wealth has enhanced his influence to a degree that no other political figure on the horizon can equal.
